question.body: In which situation will we not be able to use the confidence interval we developed?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The sample is randomly selected and even though the distribution is skewed, the sample size is more than 30. Please try again.
Incorrect. The sample is randomly selected and the sample size is much more than 30. Please try again.

Correct. The first requirement of a random sample was not achieved. Not only did the researcher use volunteers, but it is quite possible that patients at a sports clinic exercise more than the typical person. Without a random sample, it does not matter what the sample size or the type of distribution are.
Incorrect. The sample is randomly chosen, and even though the sample size is much less than 30, the distribution is normal. Please try again.
